content:
From: Makarius <makarius@sketis.net>
Dear Isabelle users,

we are making quick progress with the Isabelle2022, which is to be finalized
until 23-Oct-2022.

The release process is continuously documented on the blog entry
https://isabelle-dev.sketis.net/phame/post/view/58/release_candidates_for_isabelle2022
--- this includes a list of notable changes.

The current release candidate is
https://isabelle.sketis.net/website-Isabelle2022-RC2

A corresponding version of the Archive of Formal Proofs is
https://isabelle.sketis.net/repos/afp-devel/rev/34a31d29f666.

Any feedback about Isabelle release candidates should be posted with a
meaningful Subject (not just a clone of the announcement).

Makarius

From: Peter Lammich <lammich@in.tum.de>
Report on porting Isabelle-LLVM to 2022-RC2:

except for the vanished syntactic typeclass for signed_division (see
previous mail), I had no problems at all to port Isabelle-LLVM to the
2022-RC2 version.

From: "\"Blanchette, J.C. (Jasmin Christian)\"" <cl-isabelle-users@lists.cam.ac.uk>
Hi Peter,

Yes, it's trying different parameters for the provers. Sometimes the proof just ends up being the same.

Cheers,
Jasmin
